0955CA5451D8441A8ACDF1F2D8E596B0.description: demonstrate appropriate strategies to provide feedback that is a positive reflection of a presentation and/or encourages the presenter and audience to consider other ideas and additional information; e.g., I like it when you said ..., you may want to consider ...

30EE26DD2633429484A17B175B3A04AB.description: use appropriate criteria and teamwork tools to assess and monitor group processes; e.g., checklists, role descriptors, flow charts, discussion and questions

9C46ECCA2CE54F8383C73317854FBE47.description: engage in effective evaluations by realizing the importance of tact, honesty and specificity in peer and self-evaluation

FC2AB800F49041C88C957D8BDDB3DDE6.description: identify and apply appropriate leadership styles to motivate a group; e.g., be cooperative and supportive and use appropriate problem-solving strategies

BAAE7BD9E87844EB8AE6577A8C6F082F.description: recognize the various roles and responsibilities of group members, e.g., recorder, chair, Elder and coworker, and appreciate the contribution that these roles make to the group process

96AD1883BA434A3390FE75A44DF9B827.description: demonstrate listening and other appropriate behaviours within a group; e.g., listen without interrupting, focus on the speaker, contribute to be heard, disagree courteously, accept conflicting opinions, show respect for the rights and values of others

AF7F26E419A14494AE4C4AB52164EF8E.description: use an appropriate conflict-resolution model to identify and clarify the conflict, recognize different points of view, generate solutions, implement the best solution and assess the results

F2B9B3E5B5234CB184EB1CFB847DBD5C.description: participate effectively as a group member to facilitate the completion of group goals; e.g., generate ideas, access resources, contribute abilities and interests, monitor progress and share responsibility for completion

FC8210596D6040D88F1AA4E74CD28506.description: interact and communicate with others in a positive manner, by considering appropriate dress, space and conversational skills; e.g., when in a job interview, when communicating with a customer or coworker

C27EEE34003E40FDB7E5B52746E7AFFC.description: demonstrate respect for, and assess and defend, individual rights and differences in themselves and others, within a group or a community, in a positive and constructive manner; e.g., be fair and honest, demonstrate integrity and personal ethics

8FBEAB1706314A3B8765DEADD3FA9DDE.description: set appropriate personal goals for participation in a group, e.g., demonstrate respect and be open to and supportive of the thoughts, opinions and contributions of others, and share personal knowledge, expertise and perspectives, as appropriate

0D3B463636624F6487EB4A9E385EA452.description: Cooperate with others and contribute to group processes

32B61F1C62504215818D0487E5AFEC7F.description: identify the formal and informal ways in which language and image are used appropriately to honour and/or recognize people and celebrate events; e.g., a toast, eulogy, poster and thank-you card

2F158CC6F9BA414B99393B024349800A.description: use language and image to honour and/or recognize their own and others' accomplishments; e.g., construct e-mail and other messages conveying congratulations, thank-you notes

5AD0D89F08E345FF8F54D00CE6E528EC.description: examine the ways in which selected works of literature, and other print and nonprint texts, influence individual and group values and behaviours

8311901CE29044BB9C228D1DA5664C63.description: demonstrate an appreciation for diversity of thought and expression and select, monitor and modify, as needed, appropriate strategies for appreciating diversity

916562FA4CC7436B8845CFFADB0E0458.description: recognize and demonstrate respect for diversity, individual differences and perspectives

1979A7269CB848688DBB0867E5DBA13B.description: Appreciate diversity of expression, opinion and perspective

60C76C79815C4481BDC1A8ACBDB89F95.description: monitor the use of verbal and nonverbal communication to convey inclusion, respect and consideration

DBD3FB695CAD491894A1DE21DC4D6994.description: differentiate between constructive criticism and ridicule, and between irony and sarcasm, and use appropriate strategies to show respect

0F896690464F4E67B0A9CD6F3CF1D2B9.description: recognize positive and negative portrayals of persons in life and characters in literature and demonstrate sensitivity to the feelings of others

5DB0B5DF3B864D2DBC67DD434B7F3D30.description: use inclusive language and behaviour and communicate or create texts in ways that demonstrate respect for people of different heritage, cultures, genders, ages, abilities, opinions and communities, including aboriginal people and communities

66312D824BD04915932CDC03AEED9A65.description: Use language and image to show respect and consideration

D1F0ECCA0B1F4DD89A228BEC9A02C377.description: Respect themselves and others and strengthen community

491C9936C96A4DE689B23462C6E81FA6.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

041E92A17E7149D5BD95A4F14BDABD06.description: recognize that certain communication situations demand particular attention to correctness of punctuation, spelling, grammar, usage and sentence construction; e.g., résumés, application forms and letters, job interviews

906641E6A97A42AA8889960959A6D217.description: identify the parts of speech in their own and others' texts, e.g., nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs, to ensure correct subject-verb agreement, pronoun use and sentence structure

04FDF3B88F594A43AF40E97B2DE13A48.description: identify parts of sentences and common sentence structures, e.g., simple, compound and complex, and use transitional devices, as appropriate, to correct common errors in sentences; e.g., run-on sentences and fragments

E87327E96A7C4AB7A9E7EAE03751A286.description: apply basic capitalization, punctuation and spelling conventions, using appropriate tools; e.g., dictionaries, handbooks and spelling software/technology

717EDCF74C49409FAD9805CDD80E1340.description: revise texts to ensure clarity and coherence; e.g., editing for punctuation, spelling, usage, grammar, sentence structure, paragraph transitions, transitional devices, style and vocabulary

4EDD310B54BE4E778C09051212738139.description: use appropriate tools to assist in creating and revising text; e.g., handbooks, exemplars, models, dictionaries and spell checks/grammar checks on word processors

7A14D2ED9D9C44FB82C334C45EE7871A.description: Edit text for matters of correctness

18182FA2F9D3496DB5D170A9F59ED57B.description: demonstrate self-direction, self-discipline and the ability to work independently and effectively to improve products and/or presentations

2AFCE9EBB6154763BA706B8B923829CF.description: select and use the effective techniques, elements and matters of choice appropriate to the purpose, audience and medium; e.g., vocabulary, expressions, sentence patterns and structures, illustrations, artwork and Internet links

35766A16359842B1B04755C211BF90A9.description: Consider and address matters of choice

FF93937F86664669B408A965F499FB0F.description: manipulate graphics and text to effectively communicate a topic

8EBE66D2AF684AFD96248165016AD910.description: assess the closing of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider plan, purpose, audience and medium and to ensure an appropriate conclusion

80142CB4C6BC43BEA91183436E50F4A2.description: review the organizational components of a text in progress to strengthen the effectiveness of the components as units of thought or experience; e.g., paragraphs in a letter of application, components of a résumés or sections/slides in a multimedia presentation

ED529D7C0843441CB6D90AEC96EFF90C.description: assess the beginning of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider the plan, purpose, audience and medium

EDD1CB580B014DAAAE42BA81AD0923A9.description: create, enhance and evaluate the effectiveness of a variety of presentation forms; e.g., written/oral reports, posters, multimedia presentations, charts, collages, cartoons and Web pages

462CF265336A4B17AC00E5BB4AEFC7E2.description: demonstrate responsibility for following appropriate security and safety measures when using technology and the Internet; e.g., use appropriate language and etiquette, apply ergonomics to promote personal health and well-being and respect the products and privacy of others

C8836175617D4D45AA1D1BC8E3FB9511.description: review the accuracy and specificity of details, events, images, facts and other data intended to support a focus, controlling idea or issue and add information to support/develop as needed

64FC609A3459485686E651C3BF5758BD.description: confirm the controlling idea or desired unifying effect of a text

894E5B702A694ED2952AC520AA266FE8.description: Enhance thought, understanding, support and detail

FFE4DAF2F2504F23AEA25FC26D9B4A46.description: Improve thoughtfulness, effectiveness and correctness of communication

20BA42615A5A495F9AE4D2892656647A.description: use a consistent style when crediting sources of information in a bibliography and in footnotes

593391EF9BE24C28AFDDD0AB0E84AE6D.description: demonstrate a moral and ethical approach in the use of graphics, text and multimedia in presentations by citing sources as appropriate

8C84E3F965C34E89B99FB73F3ACDDB2E.description: demonstrate appropriate keyboarding techniques, e.g., use proper fingering when using alphabet and punctuation keys, and use a variety of strategies to increase keyboarding speed and accuracy

AEBEE92F5F0B4C97B1349E6089D0E10A.description: control aspects of style, e.g., font, size, style, colour, spacing of text, image placement, sound and video links, within the presentation form or product for consistency and/or to convey meaning

8329E709F2EB488195AC3873A65E5C60.description: develop and deliver oral, visual and multimedia presentations, using voice production factors, nonverbal factors, e.g., tone, volume, eye contact, gestures and posture, and visual production factors, e.g., colour, contrast and movement, appropriate to the purpose, audience and situation

53330C89B25C4DAB94DAA01146F2BA85.description: create presentations by integrating information gathered from various sources; e.g., use various audio and visual technologies and a variety of software, applying appropriate common conventions

F4A0376986DA493B81EF7E3600D2F832.description: create presentations and select strategies and technologies appropriate to the environment, purpose, audience and form and recognize the need for preparedness in effective communication

691E403985EA4DB0B12A7A3A35ECBF2A.description: Use production, publication and presentation strategies and technologies consistent with context

0E8E7A0AE5484710A8532CD4377642BE.description: create a variety of print, oral, visual and/or multimedia texts that reflect a controlling idea, focus, purpose and audience, including: functional writing, e.g., an advertisement for a newspaper, résumés, cover letter, business letter, using electronic templates as appropriate, real and/or sample home- and work-related forms using a variety of resources; e.g., Social Insurance Number (SIN) form, template on Human Resources Development Canada (HRDC) Web site, job application, bank account application and income tax template, computer-generated and/or other presentations to demonstrate the interview process, workplace task(s) and/or to provide other information and narrative, descriptive, persuasive and expository paragraphs and three- to five-paragraph essays appropriate to language growth for home, community and workplace applications

5FD0EF1849DD4B19AA73954F84E85325.description: apply appropriate prewriting strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology, as appropriate, discussion, brainstorms, webs, outlines, journals and notes, to explore, develop and support their own and new ideas, opinions and points of view

11FC5BC48AD1458CBD7FF45B572E1C8C.description: create content appropriate to the purpose, audience, situation and medium and incorporate appropriate examples from their personal experience

D5126E33B34944ADA60ED0992C9C5060.description: take ownership of their text creation by selecting or crafting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful and engaging

A32BBAB6BF4A484C8730A7FEB447D017.description: apply common conventions when creating oral, print, visual and multimedia texts; e.g., volume of a multimedia presentation; format of letters, memorandums and e-mail messages; structure of a résumés

B9AB7A1C87C6457A80920D793EA20DA4.description: use a medium appropriate to the content and context; e.g., television advertisement targeting specific audiences such as youth, men or women

E8E0F17A16CA425E95C6B79878BDB2C4.description: use structures consistent with the form, content and purpose; e.g., chronological order when creating a résumés, narrative or historical timeline; videotape an interview with a member of the business community or an employer

108DB344D27B4F64A2D1BA7026D098F3.description: select a text form consistent with the purpose and content; e.g., photo essay in their career portfolio that includes work experience and other community partnerships

35A257C078D44A6FBAF4F72A67D70403.description: Consider and address form, structure and medium

61539FD1C94A498D88E2F506EA8AC736.description: recognize that the depth and breadth of content will affect the format, structure and medium

3F04189A9D2B42BD9F72710BBD360CB3.description: identify the expectations and constraints of a communication; e.g., format, standards of quality, availability of resources and time

6434C1A91B9D47C3805A2B6DD6FC585A.description: consider the audience factors that affect text creation; e.g., age, gender, audience size and proximity, culture and positions of authority

A9CFB4DE025E466A814A9A323CE22263.description: determine the purpose for text creation; e.g., to inform, explain, persuade, build relationships or entertain

B0059774810245A68F42F479A0C20495.description: Develop and present a variety of print and nonprint texts

31CAD4F1088242FE87533F854C81497D.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to create oral, print, visual and multimedia texts and enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

0EE17ECD581A4E289B22CB8C6223933D.description: develop a plan to enhance the craftsmanship and accuracy of current and future work and celebrate and take pride in their efforts and accomplishments

6523780C987D403788A47D63BC442B6E.description: review the appropriateness, accuracy and significance of findings, conclusions and generalizations

75742480C20249F4839724F0EC27D88C.description: evaluate the effectiveness of the strategies used to guide the research process and identify strategies to improve future research

BBD925EDAC094468A6FF80ABA2C9B48C.description: Review inquiry or research process and findings

5DBC0D75231748549EAD9EFB67B2643C.description: use appropriate strategies, e.g., cause and effect, pros and cons, plus/minus/interesting (PMI), storyboards and Venn diagrams, when analyzing, synthesizing and evaluating information to draw conclusions or form generalizations

8808A8D175554796A52CED42EBB9785B.description: draw conclusions that are appropriate to their findings, reflect their own understandings and are consistent with the topic, purpose and situation

38D4A961A2EE436BB6120EC7D6CE0F6E.description: distinguish between support and generalization and provide evidence for generalizations and conclusions

154D605D085D4EFF83A066D92640553F.description: form generalizations by integrating new information with prior knowledge

A97705485E45468F857009281AC5A11F.description: identify multiple viewpoints and evaluate the relevancy, quality, credibility and bias of sources and information

67B2A783971E4AAF97715A51A0783D86.description: assess whether the information gathered is reliable, complete, current and significant to determine its usefulness to the overall purpose, audience and form of the presentation

99B208EAA439479093BB67A96B562308.description: assess whether information sources are credible and appropriate to the purpose, audience and form of the presentation

F519D192D58C479B97FC43A4BF185EB1.description: pply guidelines for Internet use; e.g., confidentiality, respect copyright and use rules for citing sources

41E758D0D9C945ABAFBB622AF88ED418.description: record information accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

4AC7F9CBD5C44257B24226E2E8DA654F.description: use and manage a variety of oral, print, visual and multimedia resources appropriate to a topic; e.g., textbooks, books, encyclopedias, graphs, diagrams, posters, pictures, films, databases, CD-ROMs, Web sites and the Internet

03E48F09D80A46C1B23ECF04F279EB84.description: identify and/or develop appropriate details to support the focus of an inquiry, using a variety of strategies; e.g., map/webs, graphic organizers and outlines

60ADBDAC9BD04C6C82FAB9128350AE34.description: use a variety of strategies to organize and record information; e.g., take notes in point form, outlines, webs, categorize and guide questions

40A289A2792D41A3B46B7261DD3D6097.description: select information and support materials appropriate to the purpose from a variety of print and nonprint sources, e.g., museums, government agencies, Elders, business people, periodicals, the Internet, CD-ROMs, television, radio and surveys, using a variety of strategies; e.g., skim and scan, view, question and interview

9875B98559AE45EC9F3DE109941BB81A.description: identify potential strategies and technologies for gathering, generating and recording information; e.g., Web sites; encyclopedias; interviews; skim and scan; outlines; webs; identify key words, phrases and relevant information; take notes in point form

75BD90A7E62D4C5EB6804B8031314A63.description: use questions, discussion, reflection and other appropriate strategies to guide and monitor an inquiry or research plan

D494DFE6A4244387BE6D0FC317E8BF1C.description: create an inquiry or research plan, considering a variety of factors; e.g., breadth and depth of prior knowledge, information gaps, appropriate collection tools and format, sources of information, purpose, audience, time and potential presentation form

8BD0827F5D3A4A5CA9F63C92108C1C33.description: Plan an inquiry or research process and identify information needs and sources

7D1E39CAF218488AB1A664DDD5C3C5C2.description: refine the scope and direction of an inquiry by identifying the breadth and depth of the topic and the limitations, time availability, purpose, audience and form of presentation

7681B9BBA3AF4A1B96AA617A0639DFED.description: create categories or questions to guide an inquiry

651423FF12094271801B02223BC3E25D.description: establish a focus for text creation and determine the scope by identifying an effective, controlling idea, issue or question

48CA15CF97774FEC93FDD1247897C09D.description: identify topics for research through a variety of strategies, e.g., discussion, brainstorms and webs, considering the audience, e.g., scope and potential presentation form, and the purpose; e.g., to inform, make decisions and persuade

33152A2E43E94447A9B67039A3204D04.description: Focus on purpose and presentation form

8C3F34F671F74040A0F5E55309166CE9.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

9ABFB728210045E894FC5CCCF2F26F20.description: examine and appreciate how graphic design techniques, e.g., graphic quality, colour, sound, camera angle, lighting, composition and perspective, create and/or manipulate emotion, mood and point of view

69955AB4EFB04BCE88AF1F142AC11409.description: examine and appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of techniques used in texts to present emotions, ideas and information and evoke response

CCF31E99534C49C296D93F03CCE6E31C.description: Appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of print and nonprint texts

08600F1123EC4555AF1B97AB1EB2B1BE.description: examine the images in print and nonprint texts in terms of created reality and appropriateness to purpose; e.g., sensationalizing portrayals of everyday life; representation of age/gender; use of pace, music and camera angles

552FCF6BD3824AE083FB330033FAC5F3.description: assess the settings and plots of texts in terms of created reality and plausibility

627A243867964575A847BFA8F2692DFB.description: assess the appropriateness of their own and others' understandings and interpretations of texts by referring to specific evidence

E84C8985428E449CBB4C32A22EAAD70E.description: Evaluate the relationship to realism and the appropriateness and significance of print and nonprint texts

5C6B023E79DD4C0E90C43C77850E2D5B.description: recognize Canadian content and portrayals of Canadian culture and society in print and nonprint texts

5CDFEA30C7AC4EC390902BBCFB0CC6E1.description: compare the choices and motives of characters/people portrayed in print and nonprint texts with themselves and others and recognize that the choices and motives presented in texts may provide insight into the behaviours of themselves and others

407C0BB53B164559A1BCDE303D4F7964.description: identify and consider personal moral, ethical and cultural perspectives when studying texts and reflect on how perspectives may change as a result of interpretation and discussion

4EE09538FAF448F4A52BD520C32E89A2.description: Connect themselves, text, culture and environment

B7EF8F7435FC423CB312F9E95F48906C.description: Respond to a variety of print and nonprint texts

860EA80E869A4A739855A4C656900C0D.description: identify and examine reasons for, and effectiveness of, the elements, devices and techniques used in a variety of print and nonprint texts; e.g., advertisements, music videos, films, workplace documents and Web pages

0EF5574D74854D009588E845ECB9574A.description: recognize that elements of effective oral, visual and multimedia presentations, e.g., music, colour, lighting, movement, gesture, space and shape, are used to create specific effects

6E843F1C9C624A8F8829762622E114FA.description: recognize the use of narrative hooks, foreshadowing, flashbacks, suspense and surprise endings to contribute to the effectiveness of plot development

999DDD09DB6F4258969336610156F4F8.description: recognize the use of irony, humour, simile, metaphor, personification and symbols to contribute to a theme and to create a specific effect on the audience

CC6BCDCD0F814D269518391202BDCB0B.description: Relate elements, devices and techniques to created effects

9DC780D70757415CB85FDDF40713ED96.description: identify organizational patterns and structural features that contribute to the purpose and content in common texts; e.g., headlines in newspapers; photographs in menus; text organizers such as tables of contents, indexes, headings and italic and boldface formatting

B9132BAC317C43FDB93AD81AD193A656.description: recognize that some forms, structures and media are more appropriate than others in achieving a particular purpose with an intended audience; e.g., television and radio programs and advertisements use short time segments and pacing to gain and retain audience attention

78583F26AA2B4CA4882F5E98E68E0C2F.description: recognize that audience factors, e.g., gender and culture, influence form, structure and media

64411C32D9D74BA980A19571B7132A13.description: identify common text forms and their purposes, including communication forms, e.g., letters, e-mail messages and memoranda, and literary forms; e.g., poems, narratives, dramatizations and oral stories

3ED478218B0A480BA81071464D60D309.description: Relate form, structure and medium to purpose, audience and content

1BD6F0C2D87F487BBA41B3FB9B16725E.description: Understand and appreciate textual forms, elements and techniques

350E8A06AB4A4DF7BDB6283B4118A0EC.description: use a variety of reference strategies and technologies to aid their understanding and create their own reference materials; e.g., take notes; use library catalogues; create a personalized dictionary, telephone/address books and a World Wide Web/URL address list

4C5FEF09C08F46B695570D68B6484032.description: record information sources in a bibliography or footnotes, accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

9F64BB8AA7524B3889D10A2B36141BB1.description: Use reference strategies and reference technologies

6828510B0149458486E1BEE3C7B4AF69.description: recognize that past experiences influence their understandings and interpretations of texts

D0ADB77ECD7B4D9FB66F7418B66F1299.description: relate their previous knowledge and experiences to enhance their understanding of new texts

D29C89DC04854D57B1163924C9C7D32C.description: identify visual elements, e.g., graphics, lists, graphs and charts, and the use of sound, e.g., music, sound effects and silence, and examine their contribution to the meaning of texts; e.g., the use of symbols and music in advertising by sports teams and food outlets

C42CF598B81F42D0914557FF7E06E4D9.description: differentiate between literal and figurative statements and/or representations, describe images developed in texts, recognize imagery in a variety of texts, e.g., advertising, comic strips, comedy in television and movies, popular music, and recognize the meaning and purpose of these statements, representations and images

64ADD2C37E0C47CBAD0D20B9FC786A05.description: evaluate the effectiveness of nonverbal cues in conveying a speaker's intent

CCE5315DE65A45BABDE92DFEC66975FC.description: examine and evaluate the effectiveness of verbal cues in conveying a speaker's intent; e.g., volume, tone and mood

1083B7F1645B4823A3F5D6AC6A02EFAE.description: paraphrase directions or messages to enhance their comprehension and complete tasks; e.g., oral directions at the workplace, assignments, manuals, diagrams, forms, lists and labels

4B905D93A5EB488695748687CC59FEBD.description: apply appropriate vocabulary strategies to enhance their comprehension of oral, print and multimedia texts; e.g., word attack skills, contextual clues and dictionary skills

E2FCFA02BD3449E6A28B6ED717CE4E4F.description: identify and examine change in a character as a result of an event within a plot by examining elements of character, e.g., personality traits, motivation, relationships, attitudes, values, consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change, and relate a character's behaviour to their own personal experience, as appropriate

CFE15DDDE0A242E8ABBCF6D5B514417D.description: recognize the relationships among plot, setting, character and conflict by relating to prior knowledge, personal experience and new ideas

731999C2E398419288B88FC8F224D87C.description: categorize parts of a plot using a variety of strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology as appropriate, including introduction, characters, setting, initial incident, rising action, climax, falling action and resolution, and assess the effectiveness of those strategies in relation to the purpose and audience

80896A05616849C9981A1DD1D4C40777.description: summarize the controlling idea, supporting ideas, details and conflicts in a text to enhance understanding

44DCCC1E262740FBB2EF9BDDBB5B2941.description: use a variety of appropriate reading strategies to enhance their comprehension of print texts; e.g., skim; read out loud; reread; form questions; make predictions; use contextual clues, graphic organizers and summarization

CCC96DB50E894C0382122D47D2E17BB6.description: recognize the impact that personal contexts, e.g., experience and prior knowledge, have on the construction of meaning in a text

EEC6DEBEF6ED4B6EA2A559E3AB4BD52F.description: use references to gain the historical and societal background and to enhance their understanding of specific texts; e.g., personal experiences, community leaders, teachers and Elders

BED4C25B80854B8697B5DA51E4552E27.description: recognize that a variety of factors influence the creation of texts; e.g., constraints of time and space, audience, culture, societal norms and historical background

D83820367BA743CEB5F3BB3B74FBA621.description: identify the key messages and features of a text that provide information about the creator's purpose and intended audience; e.g., the use of jargon, idioms, specialized workplace terminology and illustrations

89CA58A1F5C24135A249C42AC366F4A6.description: examine a variety of texts and identify their audience and purpose for creation to inform, persuade, entertain or inspire; e.g., advertisements, instruction manuals, newspapers, magazines, Web sites, CD-ROMs, music lyrics and documentary dramas

992F7DBA11EA413586585DC2C8856EFE.description: Construct meaning from text and context

A4861DCDB182425EB51D2CDBF4A99A2A.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

A8D4D2F439364861940FC9F30EC4B127.description: demonstrate a willingness to continuously learn and grow as effective communicators

07B2A12B5D2144F5A003909C0F3ACA11.description: apply strategies to increase their personal potential; e.g., set short- and long-term goals, create an action plan and build a career portfolio

6BEA1BE41C6648BE8F52C480AD8528EA.description: create a plan to enhance language learning based on their personal goals and in relation to everyday home, community and workplace communication

BE34C5836EFF4E008C39FCFA25489F22.description: investigate and evaluate the language skills required to achieve attainable secondary, post-secondary and career goals, using appropriate strategies and resources; e.g., Web sites such as the Alberta Learning Information Service (ALIS) and the National Occupational Classification (NOC) system

12AC3823AC414B30B062F510BF8E65B7.description: use guided peer and/or self-evaluation to assess their strengths and areas needing improvement, using a variety of strategies; e.g., checklists, skills inventories and discussion

BB3948838A1E4CCFABCD0F0F15756537.description: Set personal goals for language growth

F23006C71009467EB002FCB7BCE6CACA.description: explore and assess a range of print and nonprint texts to expand their interests, including those used in the community and the workplace; e.g., newspapers, live drama, workplace/community health information manuals and product promotional materials

D773FE0257474C2FA2B216D6A9695882.description: select and apply strategies to expand their interests in various text creations, e.g., Web sites, advertising and promotional texts, workplace manuals, CD-ROMs, movies and music videos, including the use of language, image, sound and structure

DB3AEDC78D0E44199A801122AC8986C1.description: apply strategies to expand their interests in print and nonprint texts and text creators; e.g., sharing reading/viewing/listening inventories, discuss the role marketing plays in shaping popular culture, visit a museum or a community cultural or art centre

D6E445508BE44DE4B900D5B21B4E5ECC.description: identify and examine the personal text preferences and other factors influencing personal preferences; e.g., purpose, interest, peers, family, heritage, advertisements and technology

6F74CE4266AB40E19812B0F8BD455910.description: compare their own ideas, perspectives and interpretations to those of others through a variety of strategies; e.g., discussion and pro-con/think-pair-share charts

77B6DEE6417B4C7191F092288D8D20FC.description: evaluate personal responses to determine the: extent of the information included in the explanation, evidence offered to support the response and degree of support for the response

61A5459E61DE4533AEAF03E9067CA206.description: experiment with a variety of strategies, activities and resources to explore ideas, observations, opinions, experiences and emotions; e.g., exploratory talk; keep a journal; take part in a sharing circle; interview a member of the community, a local employer or a coworker

C3BE34CF9AB347BDB33F7E6C52203243.description: experiment with language, image and structure to create different effects for specific purposes and audiences; e.g., when creating components of a career portfolio, preparing a visual representation or completing workplace tasks

D35377DF244349FB828F5D91572137D4.description: Experiment with language, image and structure

2F18B0B7E58E4DC68DA0DA9F2600AACC.description: form and communicate tentative understandings, interpretations and positions on ideas and information presented in print and nonprint texts through discussion or by using various communication technologies; e.g., telephone and e-mail

71AB6551DD244BCD969318FB7CF7B5C3.description: experiment with strategies that contribute to the formation of tentative understandings, interpretations and positions; e.g., pose questions, discuss, keep an open mind, reread, review and recognize that texts may be inaccurate or misleading

6740585FF04640B6AE2974222E348E75.description: Form tentative understandings, interpretations and positions

5D9FC4F6FE5D496093DDCA5AA980DB89.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
